Hormuz, the world's oil chokepoint, is under tension
description: A blockade of the strait, through which one-fifth of global oil consumption passes, would have a catastrophic impact on the world economy. Iran, which depends on its oil revenues, has much to lose, as does China, its main customer.

headline: Government orders recall of all at-risk vehicles with Takata airbags and immobilizes 800,000 additional cars
description: The transport minister has expanded measures to protect drivers from accidental explosions of defective Takata airbags. Some 2.5 million vehicles are now affected, and among them, 1.7 million have been banned from being driven.

headline: Lyon handed Ligue 2 relegation by financial regulator
description: Lyon can appeal the decision, but if their relegation is confirmed, they would be replaced in Ligue 1 by Reims.

headline: PSG courts Americans to grow brand and revenues in the US
description: The Club World Cup is much more than just a sporting event for the Parisian football team. It is a golden opportunity to expand its influence in a lucrative market.

headline: The Heritage Foundation sets its sights on Europe
description: Since the beginning of his term, Donald Trump has been applying Project 2025, a 922-page bible written by the conservative think tank. Today, its president, Kevin Roberts, is looking across the Atlantic. On a visit to France, he met with leaders of far-right parties.

headline: 'They come in vans and arrest mothers': Fear of immigration raids grips Chicago
description: In Chicago, another sanctuary city targeted by Donald Trump, residents have been organizing to thwart arrests by federal immigration agents and protect the country's second-largest Mexican community, after Los Angeles.
